intro: Hosackia mollis, commonly known as the slender milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant has trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, hairy pods that contain several seeds. Hosackia mollis thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes, often in areas with well-drained soil. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and native plant restoration efforts.
